tactics.name: Klopp's Legacy 4-2-3-1
tactics.author: TacticalFM
tactics.description: An aggressive high-pressing system inspired by the gegenpressing philosophy. The team applies intense pressure immediately after losing the ball, aiming to win it back within five seconds in the opponent's half. The double pivot provides a base for the front four to press relentlessly, while the full-backs push high to create width and numerical superiority. Best suited for squads with high stamina, work rate, and determination across all outfield positions. Dominates possession-based sides that struggle under sustained pressure.
tactics.shortDescription: Relentless high press with a double pivot and aggressive front four.
squadRequirements: High stamina and work rate across all outfield positions
Fast, aggressive pressing forwards with good off-the-ball movement
Box-to-Box or Ball-Winning midfielders in the double pivot
Full-backs comfortable pushing high and defending in space
Goalkeeper comfortable sweeping behind a high defensive line

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Man Utd
evidence.notes: Very strong against sides that try to play out from the back. Can be exposed on the counter when both full-backs push high. Fitness concerns in congested fixtures; rotate aggressively.

tactics.name: Positional Tiki-Taka 4-3-3
tactics.author: PossessionGuru
tactics.description: A patient, possession-oriented system built around positional play and short, incisive passing combinations. The single pivot anchors the midfield while two advanced midfielders create triangles across the pitch. The wide forwards drift inward to overload central areas, while full-backs provide width. Out of possession, the team shifts to a 4-1-4-1 shape with the pivot sitting deep and the wide forwards tracking back. This tactic requires technically gifted players throughout the squad and a goalkeeper comfortable with distribution.
tactics.shortDescription: Patient possession game with positional triangles and controlled tempo.
squadRequirements: Technically excellent midfielders with high passing and vision
A dominant deep-lying playmaker or regista as the single pivot
Intelligent forwards capable of positional interchange
Full-backs who can retain possession under pressure
Sweeper-keeper comfortable receiving back passes and distributing

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Man City
evidence.notes: Dominant possession numbers but can struggle to break down deep, compact defences. Vulnerable to fast transitions if the full-backs are caught high. Works best with elite technical players; drop-off is significant with weaker squads.

tactics.name: Big Sam's Route One 4-4-2
tactics.author: DirectPlayFC
tactics.description: A direct, no-nonsense approach built around launching long balls to a target man and playing off the second ball. The strike partnership is key: a physical target man to hold up play and win aerial duels, paired with a quick poacher to exploit knock-downs. The flat midfield four maintains discipline and wins the midfield battle through physicality rather than technique. This tactic is ideal for lower-budget sides punching above their weight, where squad quality does not support a possession game.
tactics.shortDescription: Direct long-ball football with a target man and second-ball exploitation.
squadRequirements: A strong aerial target man with good hold-up play
A quick, clinical striker to play off the target man
Physically strong central midfielders who win second balls
Wide midfielders with good crossing and work rate
Tall centre-backs comfortable with aerial challenges

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, West Ham
evidence.notes: Effective at neutralising stronger sides and punishing them on the break. Set-piece goals are a major source of output. Pass completion is low by design. Works best when the target man has elite heading and strength attributes.

tactics.name: Modern Catenaccio 5-3-2
tactics.author: DefensiveMaster
tactics.description: A modernised take on the classic Italian Catenaccio, prioritising defensive solidity above all else. Three centre-backs provide layered coverage with one acting as a sweeper, while the wing-backs tuck in to form a back five out of possession. The midfield trio sits deep to clog passing lanes and stifle opposition build-up. On the counter, the wing-backs burst forward and the two strikers provide direct outlets. This system is designed for underdogs facing superior opposition, trading possession for defensive resilience and clinical counter-attacks.
tactics.shortDescription: Ultra-defensive three-centre-back system with lethal counter-attacks.
squadRequirements: Three disciplined centre-backs with good positioning and concentration
Wing-backs with the stamina to cover the entire flank both ways
A midfield anchor to protect the back three
A quick striker to exploit space on the counter-attack
Players with high teamwork, work rate, and defensive attributes

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Ipswich Town
evidence.notes: Outperforms xG significantly on the defensive end due to shot quality conceded being poor. Keeps Ipswich competitive in the top flight despite limited squad quality. Draw rate is very high. Struggles to create volume but clinical finishing makes a big difference.

tactics.name: Fluid Counter-Attack 4-1-4-1
tactics.author: TransitionKing
tactics.description: A balanced, transition-focused system that excels at absorbing pressure and striking quickly on the break. The lone defensive midfielder screens the back four while four midfielders provide both defensive coverage and attacking thrust. In possession, the shape opens up with the AMC pushing forward and wide players drifting inward. Out of possession, the team drops into a compact 4-4-1-1 with the AMC becoming a second pressing layer ahead of the midfield four. Designed for sides who face more possession-dominant opponents regularly.
tactics.shortDescription: Balanced system built around rapid transitions and fluid midfield movement.
squadRequirements: A disciplined defensive midfielder with good anticipation and positioning
Pacy wide players who can transition from defence to attack quickly
An intelligent AMC who can press and create in equal measure
Full-backs comfortable in a disciplined defensive role
A mobile lone striker who can hold the ball up and run the channels

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Wolves
evidence.notes: Very balanced profile. Concedes fewer shots on target than expected despite lower possession. Quality of chances created is high, with good xG conversion. Most effective against teams that commit numbers forward. The AMC transition between phases is the tactical linchpin.

tactics.name: Dynamic Wing Play 3-4-2-1
tactics.author: WideOverload
tactics.description: An attacking system that generates width through overlapping wing-backs in a three-at-the-back framework. The two number tens drift into half-spaces to create overloads, while the wing-backs provide natural width and crossing opportunities. The double pivot holds the midfield and covers for the marauding wing-backs. Out of possession, the wing-backs drop into a back five, forming a solid 5-4-1 shape. Requires exceptional wing-backs with elite stamina and crossing ability to function properly.
tactics.shortDescription: Width-focused 3-at-the-back with overlapping wing-backs and half-space overloads.
squadRequirements: Elite wing-backs with pace, stamina, crossing, and defensive ability
Three centre-backs comfortable in a wider defensive line
Creative number tens who can operate in half-spaces
A double pivot providing both protection and distribution
A mobile striker who can link play and finish from crosses

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Brighton
evidence.notes: Generates a high volume of crossing opportunities and set pieces. Wing-back fitness is critical; performance drops sharply when backups are used. Vulnerable to quick central transitions when wing-backs are caught upfield. Set-piece goals benefit from the three tall centre-backs.

tactics.name: Total Football 4-3-3
tactics.author: CruyffDisciple
tactics.description: A fluid, high-intensity system inspired by the total football philosophy where every outfield player is expected to interchange positions fluidly. The Regista orchestrates from deep, the full-backs invert into midfield to create central overloads, and the front three rotate constantly. Out of possession, the team immediately presses with extreme intensity, mirroring the gegenpress but with more positional chaos. This system demands the highest-quality, most versatile players available; every outfield player needs to be comfortable in multiple positions. The reward is an utterly unpredictable, creatively devastating attacking style.
tactics.shortDescription: Fluid total football with constant positional interchange and creative freedom.
squadRequirements: Highly versatile players comfortable in multiple positions
A Regista with elite vision, passing, and composure
Full-backs capable of inverting into central midfield
Technically brilliant forwards who interchange fluidly
High mental attributes across the squad: decisions, teamwork, off the ball
Goalkeeper comfortable as a sweeper-keeper

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Arsenal
evidence.notes: The highest-performing tactic in testing when used with elite squads. The gap between this and weaker squads is enormous; do not use with lower-league sides. Fitness management is critical. The positional interchange creates confusion but requires high mental stats to execute. Title-winning calibre with the right players.

tactics.name: Resolute Low Block 4-4-2
tactics.author: ParkTheBus
tactics.description: The ultimate bus-parking setup. Two banks of four sit deep and narrow, compressing space in the defensive third and forcing opponents wide into low-percentage crossing positions. The team barely presses, conserving energy and maintaining shape at all costs. The two strikers stay high as outlets for rare counter-attacks, with one dropping to collect long balls and the other stretching the defensive line with runs in behind. This is a survival tactic, purpose-built for keeping scores low against vastly superior sides. Not pretty, but brutally effective at grinding out results.
tactics.shortDescription: Deep, compact defensive block with two banks of four and rare counter-attacks.
squadRequirements: Disciplined, positionally aware defenders with high concentration
Central midfielders with exceptional work rate and stamina
Wide midfielders willing to sacrifice attacking contribution for defensive duties
At least one quick striker to provide a counter-attacking outlet
A commanding goalkeeper who organises the defence

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Southampton
evidence.notes: Massively outperforms xGA due to the quality of chances conceded being very low (mostly long-range efforts and wide crosses). The PPG is modest but keeps a relegation-calibre squad competitive. High draw rate is the backbone of survival. Extremely boring to watch but effective at grinding points.

tactics.name: Mourinho's Fortress 5-3-2
tactics.author: DefensiveMind
tactics.description: An ultra-defensive system designed to frustrate the opposition by packing the defensive third with bodies. Five defenders and three disciplined midfielders form an almost impenetrable wall, while two strikers wait for scraps on the counter. The team sits extremely deep with minimal pressing, conserving energy and waiting for the opponent to make mistakes. When possession is won, quick vertical passes aim to release the strikers into space behind the opposition's high defensive line. Ideal for massive underdogs facing far superior teams, or when protecting a late lead.
tactics.shortDescription: Ultra-defensive wall with two strikers lurking on the counter.
squadRequirements: Disciplined defenders with strong marking and tackling
Midfielders with high work rate and stamina for covering space
Quick strikers with good finishing and off-the-ball movement
A commanding goalkeeper who dominates the penalty area
Full squad commitment to defensive shape and discipline

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Ipswich Town
evidence.notes: Remarkably effective at keeping the score close. Low possession but extremely efficient with chances. Perfect for relegation-threatened sides. Struggles in games where you need to chase the result.

tactics.name: False Nine Strikerless 4-3-3
tactics.author: TacticalFM
tactics.description: A revolutionary strikerless system where the centre-forward drops deep as a False Nine, creating a void that pulls centre-backs out of position. The inside forwards exploit the space vacated by confused defenders, making runs beyond the False Nine. The midfield trio dominates the centre of the park with a deep-lying playmaker recycling possession and two mezzalas making late runs into the box. This system overwhelms opponents who rely on man-marking and creates constant numerical superiority in midfield.
tactics.shortDescription: Strikerless system with a False Nine dragging defenders out of position.
squadRequirements: An intelligent False Nine with excellent passing, vision, and movement
Inside forwards with pace, finishing, and off-the-ball intelligence
Creative midfielders who can arrive late in the box
Full-backs who provide width to stretch the play
Players comfortable with positional interchange and fluid roles

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Arsenal
evidence.notes: Extremely effective against teams that push high. The False Nine creates chaos in the opposition's defensive structure. Can struggle against deep blocks where there is no space to exploit behind defenders.

tactics.name: Asymmetric Overload 4-2-3-1
tactics.author: ModernTactician
tactics.description: A sophisticated asymmetric system that creates numerical overloads on the left flank while maintaining defensive stability on the right. The left full-back pushes high as an inverted wing-back, tucking inside to create a midfield diamond, while the right full-back stays deep. The left winger hugs the touchline providing width, while the right-sided attacker cuts inside as an inverted winger. This creates unpredictable patterns of play that are extremely difficult for opponents to defend against, as the shape constantly shifts between a 3-2-4-1 and a 4-2-3-1.
tactics.shortDescription: Asymmetric system creating left-sided overloads with inverted movements.
squadRequirements: A versatile left-back comfortable inverting into midfield
A natural winger on the left who can deliver crosses
An inverted winger on the right with cutting inside ability
Intelligent midfielders who understand spatial awareness
A disciplined right-back who can cover defensively

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Aston Villa
evidence.notes: The left-sided overload is devastating against teams that defend narrowly. Opposition managers struggle to prepare for the asymmetry. Right flank can feel isolated at times.

tactics.name: Relentless Press 4-4-2
tactics.author: PressureFC
tactics.description: A ferocious high-pressing 4-4-2 that aims to suffocate the opposition in their own half. Both strikers lead the press from the front while the wide midfielders squeeze inward to cut off passing lanes. The two central midfielders are energetic ball-winners who recycle possession quickly. Unlike traditional 4-4-2 systems, this variant pushes the defensive line extremely high to compress the pitch, reducing the opponent's time on the ball to a minimum. Requires exceptional fitness levels across the squad.
tactics.shortDescription: Ferocious high-pressing 4-4-2 that suffocates opponents in their own half.
squadRequirements: Exceptional stamina and work rate across all positions
Two mobile, hardworking strikers who press from the front
Wide midfielders with the discipline to tuck in defensively
Ball-winning central midfielders with good passing range
Fast centre-backs comfortable defending high up the pitch

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Newcastle
evidence.notes: Incredibly intense and creates a lot of turnovers in dangerous areas. Teams that try to play out from the back get destroyed. Fitness is a real concern — expect injuries without heavy rotation.

tactics.name: Wing-Back Blitz 3-5-2
tactics.author: WideOverload
tactics.description: An ultra-aggressive 3-5-2 that weaponizes the wing-backs as the primary attacking threat. Both wing-backs push extremely high, essentially acting as wingers, while a back three provides the security to allow them forward. The midfield three controls the tempo, with a deep-lying playmaker orchestrating play and two box-to-box midfielders supporting both phases. The two strikers combine through link-up play and movement. This system overwhelms defences with width and numbers in the final third.
tactics.shortDescription: Aggressive 3-5-2 with wing-backs as the primary attacking weapon.
squadRequirements: Athletic wing-backs with pace, stamina, and crossing ability
Three centre-backs comfortable in a back three, with pace on the flanks
A deep-lying playmaker to control the tempo from midfield
Two complementary strikers (one target man, one runner)
High team fitness for the demanding wing-back roles

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Brighton
evidence.notes: Wing-backs create a huge amount of chances from crosses and cutbacks. Vulnerable to quick counter-attacks through the centre when wing-backs are caught high. Three-at-back transitions can be shaky against pacy forwards.

tactics.name: Counter-Punch 4-4-1-1
tactics.author: TransitionMaster
tactics.description: A disciplined counter-attacking system built around the 4-4-1-1 formation. The team defends in a compact mid-block, staying organised and difficult to break down. The attacking midfielder sits in the hole between the opposition's midfield and defence, ready to spring into action during transitions. When possession is won, the team looks to break at speed through the AMC and the lone striker, with wide midfielders providing outlet passes on the flanks. A patient, pragmatic approach suited to underdogs.
tactics.shortDescription: Disciplined mid-block with devastating counter-attacks through the AMC.
squadRequirements: A clinical lone striker who can hold up play and finish chances
A creative AMC with pace, vision, and dribbling ability
Disciplined wide midfielders who track back and break forward
Two solid central midfielders with good defensive positioning
Well-organized centre-backs who read the game

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Wolves
evidence.notes: Very efficient on the counter and hard to break down. The AMC is the key — his quality determines how effective the transitions are. Can be frustrating when chasing games as the system isn't built to dominate possession.

tactics.name: Rapid Transition 4-1-4-1
tactics.author: CounterStrike
tactics.description: A direct, transition-focused 4-1-4-1 designed to win the ball back quickly and launch devastating counter-attacks. The lone DM acts as a shield in front of the defence, while the four midfielders are positioned to press and win the ball in central areas. Once possession is won, the team immediately looks to play vertical passes to release the wide midfielders or the lone striker. The system is built around speed of transition rather than sustained possession, making it effective against teams that commit numbers forward.
tactics.shortDescription: Lightning-fast transitions from a compact 4-1-4-1 defensive shape.
squadRequirements: A mobile lone striker with pace and clinical finishing
Fast wide midfielders who can carry the ball at speed
A disciplined DM who wins the ball and distributes quickly
Centre-backs with pace to cover behind a mid-block
Full-backs who can join attacks on the transition

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Crystal Palace
evidence.notes: Lethal on the break against open teams. The wide midfielders are the key — their pace on the transition creates havoc. Less effective when opponents sit deep and deny the space to counter into.

tactics.name: Build From Back 3-5-2
tactics.author: PossessionGuru
tactics.description: A possession-oriented 3-5-2 that builds patiently from the back three. The ball-playing centre-backs form the foundation, stepping into midfield to create numerical superiority in the build-up phase. The wing-backs provide width on both flanks while the midfield trio controls the tempo. This system excels at drawing opponents out of shape through patient circulation before exploiting spaces with incisive through-balls. The two strikers combine with clever movement, one dropping deep and one running in behind.
tactics.shortDescription: Patient possession from a back three with controlled build-up play.
squadRequirements: Ball-playing centre-backs comfortable stepping into midfield
Technically gifted wing-backs who can receive in tight spaces
A deep-lying playmaker with exceptional passing range
Two complementary strikers with good link-up play
Goalkeeper comfortable with back passes and short distribution

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Chelsea
evidence.notes: Exceptional at controlling games and keeping the ball away from the opposition. The regista is the heartbeat. Vulnerable to quick pressing teams that don't allow the centre-backs time on the ball.

tactics.name: Pragmatic Block 4-4-1-1
tactics.author: ResultsMatter
tactics.description: A results-oriented 4-4-1-1 inspired by Mourinho's most pragmatic setups. The team defends in a deep, compact 4-4-1-1 shape, denying the opposition space to play through. The AMC links defence and attack, dropping to help midfield when out of possession but springing forward when the ball is won. Direct balls over the top target the lone striker, who holds up play for runners. Two banks of four make this system extremely difficult to break down, and the direct style of attack minimises the risk of losing the ball in dangerous areas.
tactics.shortDescription: Deep-defending 4-4-1-1 that hits opponents on the break with direct play.
squadRequirements: A physical striker who can hold the ball up and win aerial duels
A versatile AMC who contributes defensively and creates on the break
Hardworking wide midfielders who can defend and cross
Two disciplined central midfielders with good positioning
Centre-backs who are dominant in the air and strong in the tackle

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Fulham
evidence.notes: Grinds out results against superior opposition. The target man is vital for giving the team an outlet. Don't expect pretty football — this is about points, not performance metrics.

tactics.name: High-Line Press 3-4-2-1
tactics.author: PressureFC
tactics.description: An aggressive gegenpressing system using a 3-4-2-1 formation that creates a man-marking trap all over the pitch. The three centre-backs allow the wing-backs to push extremely high, creating a 3-2-5 shape in possession. The two attacking midfielders and the striker lead an intense press from the front, while the two central midfielders cut off passing lanes. Out of possession, the wing-backs drop back to form a 5-4-1 shape. This high-risk, high-reward system can overwhelm opponents but is vulnerable to teams who can bypass the press.
tactics.shortDescription: Aggressive 3-4-2-1 gegenpress with wing-backs creating a 3-2-5 in attack.
squadRequirements: Three fast, aggressive centre-backs who can defend in space
Tireless wing-backs with exceptional stamina
Two energetic central midfielders who can cover huge distances
Creative, pressing-savvy attacking midfielders
A mobile striker who leads the press from the front

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Tottenham
evidence.notes: Extremely entertaining and generates a lot of goals at both ends. The wing-backs are the key to making this work. Can be chaotic defensively but the high press usually compensates by winning the ball back quickly.

tactics.name: Target Man Direct 4-4-2
tactics.author: OldSchoolFM
tactics.description: A classic English-style direct 4-4-2 built around a dominant target man. The goalkeeper and defenders launch long balls toward the target man, who wins aerial duels and flicks the ball on for the supporting striker and onrushing midfielders. The wide midfielders deliver crosses from deep, aiming for the target man in the box. This approach bypasses the opponent's midfield entirely, turning the game into a battle in the final third. Simple, effective, and devastating when you have the right physical profile.
tactics.shortDescription: Classic direct play built around a dominant target man partnership.
squadRequirements: A physically dominant target man with heading, strength, and hold-up play
A quick, mobile support striker who feeds off knockdowns
Wide midfielders with good crossing and delivery
Central midfielders who win second balls and support attacks
Tall, physical defenders who dominate set pieces

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Brentford
evidence.notes: Low pass completion is expected with direct play. Set piece goals are a massive bonus — the physical presence dominates corners and free kicks. Struggles against teams with dominant aerial centre-backs.

tactics.name: Lower League Warrior 4-4-2
tactics.author: GiantKiller
tactics.description: A no-nonsense 4-4-2 specifically designed for lower league management where player quality is limited. The system prioritises simplicity — every player has a clear, easily understood role. Direct passing minimises the risk of losing the ball in dangerous areas, while a hard-working mentality ensures the team competes physically. The two strikers play off each other with a simple big man/little man partnership. Wide midfielders deliver early crosses and track back diligently. Perfect for teams where work rate and desire matter more than technical ability.
tactics.shortDescription: Simple, effective 4-4-2 designed for lower league squads with limited ability.
squadRequirements: Two hardworking strikers — one physical, one mobile
Wide midfielders with crossing ability and defensive work rate
Central midfielders with stamina and aggression over technique
Tough, no-nonsense centre-backs who command the box
Players with high determination and team work attributes

evidence.context: English League Two, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Doncaster Rovers
evidence.notes: Overperforms at lower league level where technical quality is generally low. The simple system means even weak players understand their roles. Set pieces are a goldmine with physical players. Tested in League Two.

tactics.name: Balanced Controller 4-2-3-1
tactics.author: AllRounder
tactics.description: A versatile, well-balanced 4-2-3-1 that can adapt to any opponent. The double pivot provides a stable platform, with one deeper and one more advanced, creating natural passing triangles. The wide attackers have freedom to drift inside or stay wide based on the game state, while the AMC orchestrates the final third. This is a safe pick for managers who want a tactic that performs consistently across different match situations without extreme strengths or weaknesses. Works with a wide range of player types.
tactics.shortDescription: Versatile, balanced 4-2-3-1 that adapts to any opponent or game state.
squadRequirements: A creative AMC with good vision and passing
Two midfielders who complement each other in the double pivot
Versatile wide attackers comfortable in multiple roles
A reliable striker who can lead the line solo
Solid defenders who are comfortable with the ball at their feet

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, West Ham
evidence.notes: The ultimate all-rounder. Doesn't dominate any single metric but performs consistently well across the board. Ideal for managers who want a reliable baseline tactic that works in most situations.

tactics.name: Inverted Fullback 4-3-3
tactics.author: ModernTactician
tactics.description: A cutting-edge 4-3-3 inspired by Pep Guardiola's inverted full-back system. Both full-backs tuck inside when in possession, forming a double pivot with the deep midfielder and creating a 3-2-2-3 attacking shape. The natural wingers stay wide to provide maximum width, while the inverted full-backs add bodies to the midfield battle. This creates overwhelming central superiority while maintaining wide threat through the wingers. The system requires highly intelligent full-backs who can play as central midfielders.
tactics.shortDescription: Guardiola-inspired 4-3-3 with inverted fullbacks creating a 3-2-2-3 shape.
squadRequirements: Intelligent full-backs comfortable playing as inverted midfielders
Wide forwards who maintain width and stretch the defence
A deep-lying playmaker who orchestrates from the base of midfield
Ball-playing centre-backs who can step forward confidently
A mobile striker comfortable with positional interchange

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Man City
evidence.notes: Dominant possession with exceptional defensive solidity from the midfield overload. The inverted full-backs are the key — without intelligent players in those roles, the system falls apart. One of the best tactics for elite squads.

tactics.name: Narrow High Press 4-1-4-1
tactics.author: TacticalFM
tactics.description: A narrow, aggressive 4-1-4-1 pressing system that compresses the pitch centrally. The four midfielders play narrow to cut off passing lanes through the middle, forcing the opposition to play wide where they're less dangerous. The lone DM provides a defensive safety net while the midfield four press aggressively. The narrow shape creates a pressing trap in central areas, with the wide midfielders tucking in to create numerical superiority. When possession is won, the team breaks quickly through the centre with short, incisive passing.
tactics.shortDescription: Narrow 4-1-4-1 that creates a central pressing trap and breaks quickly.
squadRequirements: Four energetic, pressing-savvy midfielders with stamina
A disciplined DM who reads the game and covers space
A lone striker who can press and hold the ball up
Full-backs who provide all the width going forward
Fit, aggressive squad with high work rate

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Liverpool
evidence.notes: Absolutely devastating against teams that try to play through the middle. The narrow shape creates a wall of bodies centrally. Vulnerable to teams with quality wingers who can exploit the space out wide.

tactics.name: Rapid Counter-Attack 4-4-2
tactics.author: TransitionMaster
tactics.description: A blistering counter-attacking 4-4-2 designed to absorb pressure and strike with lethal speed. The team sits in a disciplined mid-block, drawing the opposition forward and creating space behind their defensive line. When the ball is won, the transition is immediate — direct passes find the two strikers or the wide midfielders who burst forward at pace. The central midfield pair sits deep to protect the defence but has the license to drive forward when opportunities arise. Maximum efficiency with minimum possession.
tactics.shortDescription: Lightning counter-attack from a disciplined mid-block 4-4-2.
squadRequirements: Two pacy, clinical strikers who can exploit space in behind
Fast wide midfielders who can transition from defence to attack
Central midfielders with good passing range for launch balls
A solid, well-organized defensive line
A goalkeeper comfortable with distribution to start counters

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Leicester City
evidence.notes: A giant-killer system that punches above its weight against top teams. The two quick strikers are essential. Struggles when opponents also sit deep and there's no space to counter into.

tactics.name: Positional 3-5-2 Control
tactics.author: PossessionGuru
tactics.description: A tiki-taka interpretation of the 3-5-2 that creates triangles all over the pitch. The three centre-backs provide a wide base for build-up play, with wing-backs offering width. The midfield trio passes the ball with relentless precision, drawing opponents out of shape before threading passes into the two strikers. This system combines the defensive security of a back three with the possession dominance of tiki-taka, creating a unique hybrid that is extremely hard to play against.
tactics.shortDescription: Tiki-taka principles applied to a 3-5-2 with triangle-based possession.
squadRequirements: Three ball-playing centre-backs with excellent distribution
Wing-backs who can maintain possession under pressure
A technically elite midfield trio with passing and movement
Two intelligent strikers who combine with short passes
A sweeper-keeper who acts as an extra outfield player

evidence.context: English Premier League, Holiday Sim, No Transfers, Arsenal
evidence.notes: Exceptional possession numbers with superb defensive stability from the back three. The Regista is absolutely vital to making this work. Requires elite technical players throughout — drops off sharply with average squads.
